Questions.QuestionText: Which part of the electromagnetic spectrum has the shortest wavelength?
Questions.AnswerFact: Gamma Rays have the shortest wavelength of the electromagnetic spectrum, typically less than 0.01 nanometers. Ascending in length, the order is Gamma Rays, X-Rays, Ultraviolet, Visible Light, Infrared, Microwaves and Radio Waves as the longest

Questions.QuestionText: What does a Gauss Meter measure?
Questions.AnswerFact: A Gauss Meter, also known as a Magnetometer, is a device used to measure the strength and direction of a magnetic field. Radiation is measured with a Geiger Counter, whilst the other two answers don't have a specific tool for measuring them.
